channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report X-2023080686
item.description:
Report X-2023080686

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS REMOVE FROM UNLOAD TRAILER BY AN MANAGER PUT ON A CART THEN BROUGHT TO HAZMAT CAGE DescribePack: THE CAP LOOSENED SEAL FAILED NO HOLES OR CRACKS DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PUT IN TO A HAZMAT TOTE WITH BAG

item.title: Report E-2023080774
item.description:
Report E-2023080774

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: BRIDGEPORT
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one of the metal 8 pound cylinders of oxygen(1072) was venting due to a valve that opened during transit and that 8 pounds had been released. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
